xwikidoc.title: Article Guidelines
xwikidoc.content:
= Copyright and Fair Use * Avoid quoting nearly every sentence in any article * Try to avoid more than 10 quotes per article
= Writing Style * Say "the author" rather than "you" when "talking to" the author of an article * Don't overly critisize the author e.g. "Hannity always does this" * Tactic names should be short and memorable
= General * Use good grammar, spelling, and punctuation. * When referring to any Tactic, use a link to the tactic * When referring to any outside web page, use a link * If you see a problem with the website (things not displaying properly, mistakes in others' work, etc), report it. * Avoid using any special HTML or CSS formatting tricks. * Try to use small quotes, each with just one tactic. But if doing that ruins the context, it's OK to tag one quote with 2-5 tactics. * Before creating a new Tactic, make sure it does not already exist.
